page.title: 04Farming
page.content: In our area most of the farm land is for cows and sheep but very few crops. The cows live in the lower lying fields where the grass is better while the sheep manage on the higher or rougher slopes where drainage is poorer or the land is more exposed. The crops that are grown are for the farmers own use such as feed during the winter months. The land does not lend itself readily to growing crops as it is too enclosed, too exposed or too hilly. The cows are mainly fresians, charolais and hereford. Some are used for dairy farming and some are reared for beef. The crops that can be seen growing on a small scale are wheat, barley, turnips and potatoes. The main crops are used simply for hay and silage.
